Features.Title: Animate with C#
Features.Description: Play animation clips or dedicated FlexMotion assets directly from your C# scripts with ease.

Features.Title: Method chaining
Features.Description: Control how your animations are played using expressive method chaining.

Features.Title: Easing-based transitions
Features.Description: Create smooth transitions between motion layers by setting a time and applying an [easing function](https://easings.net). Change or interrupt transitions at will.

Features.Title: 1D/2D Motion blending
Features.Description: Blend multiple animations effortlessly using convenient weight computation methods or by manually setting weight values.

Features.Title: Avatar mask layers
Features.Description: Animate different parts of your characters separately by leveraging Unity's avatar mask feature.

Features.Title: Pose
Features.Description: Set fixed poses on your characters. Transition smoothly from one pose to another pose or an animation.

Features.Title: Controllable update rate
Features.Description: Adjust the update rate of your animations to achieve stylistic effects or optimize performance.

Features.Title: Animation rigging
Features.Description: FlexMotion is fully compatible with the [Animation Rigging package](https://docs.unity3d.com/Packages/com.unity.animation.rigging@1.3/manual/index.html) through one simple component.

Features.Title: Mecanim features
Features.Description: Mecanim features like FootIK, OnAnimatorIK, Events and root motion works out of the box. With some additional features for some of them.

Features.Title: Runtime layer mirroring
Features.Description: Motion layers can be mirrored individually at runtime on any character using a humanoid rig.

Features.Title: Time callbacks
Features.Description: React to reaching a specific time or the end of an animation using convenient callbacks.

Features.Title: Mecanim blending
Features.Description: Blend in and out of a running Mecanim animator controller using a single property.
